abstract.para: Valkey is a high-performance data structure server that primarily serves key/value workloads. It supports a wide range of native structures and an extensible plugin system for adding new data structures and access patterns.

topic.para: On &sle; 16, Valkey is updated and supported according to the following rules:

listitem.para: The Valkey version is kept in sync with upstream
Each &sle; 16 minor release has the latest available version
Valkey is supported for all &sle; 16 minor releases under the general support and LTS
Backwards-compatible Valkey minor releases are published promptly after the corresponding upstream release
Patch version updates are delivered continuosly to &sle; minor releases as soon as the updates are released
Security fixes are backported if the upstream project does not issue a new release incorporating the fix
